subject: Implementation of Unified Electronic Toll Collection (ETC) technology for National Highwyas
text: HRd4 <cf4 <TTHG gfeqr<ut Th4 Phone 91-11-25074100/25074200 (Ma 4aaA, 43q 4ar7T 3k 7JAT TAT-4) #7 / Fax 91-11-25093507 25093514 National Highways Authority of India QaA IExtn:: 2223 2318 2468 2553 (Ministry of Shipping, Road Transport and Highways) 4-5 Ua 6, #qer-10, ETWT; T fardit-110 075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka, New Delhi-110075 No.11041/217/2007-Admn: 9th November, 2010 POLICY MATTER TECHNICAL (68/2010) (Decision taken on file No.NHAIICMIElectIETC/2O08) Sub: Implementation of Unified Electronic Toll Collection (ETC) Technology for National Highways The Competent Authority has approved the recommendations in the report of the Expert Committee on ETC Technology [available at WWWnhai orghwww morth nic in Roads & Highways] under the Chairmanship of Shri Nandan Nilekani; Unique Identification Authority of  India (UIDAI): Accordingly, it is decided to implement the Unified ETC technology based on Radio Frequency Identification (RFID) technology complying to EPCGen-2 and ISO:18000-6C Standards on all NHAI projects. 2 The procurement of Consultant (s) for preparation of detailed system architecture and technical specifications for implementation of interoperable ETC system is underway and shall be informed to all the stake holders  3_ This issues with the approval of the Competent Authority. (SS Nahar) Chief General Manager (Coord) To AII Officers of NHAI, HQ AII EDsIROsISLOIPIUsICMUs Copy for kind information to: PS to Chairman; NHAI PS to all MembersICVo #T { 7 NHAL 'S Il/0
